messages.content: What is the 3D-Ken-Burns effect mentioned in the document?
The 3D Ken Burns Effect is a virtual camera scan and zoom effect applied to a still image, which includes the subject to motion parallax.
What library is used for implementing several functions in CUDA?
Several functions are implemented in CUDA using CuPy.
How can I run the 3D Ken Burns effect fully automatically on an image?
To run it on an image and generate the 3D Ken Burns effect fully automatically, use the following command: python autozoom.py --in ./images/doublestrike.jpg --out ./autozoom.mp4
What dependencies need to be installed to generate video results?
Make sure to have pip install moviepy installed.
What command do I use to start the interface that allows me to manually adjust the camera path?
Can I use the project in cloud, free of charge?
Yes, you can give Colab a try. It allows you to run the project in the cloud, free of charge.
What license is the dataset provided under?
The dataset is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International Public License (CC BY-NC-SA 4.0).
Can I use the provided implementation for commercial purposes?
The project may only be used for non-commercial purposes.
Can I find Colab notebooks that should help me get started?
Yes, several people provide Colab notebooks that should get you started.
